snippet: The vast majority of voters were expected to cast ballots in favor of changing the Constitution to allow Mr. Kagame to remain in office until 2034.
abstract: Rwandans go to polls to vote on constitutional referendum that, if approved, will extend Pres Paul Kagame's tenure for 19 more years; Kagame is limited under current law to term that expires in 2017; expectation is that vast majority of voters will favor extending term.
lead_paragraph: The vast majority of voters were expected to cast ballots in favor of changing the Constitution to allow Mr. Kagame to remain in office until 2034.

headline.main: Rwanda Votes on Extending Term of President Paul Kagame
headline.print_headline: Rwandan Vote Is Expected to Change Law and Extend President’s Term

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
